titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dewitt family papers, 1863-1866
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Topics of these miscellaneous letters include the use of substitutes in the draft in New York; conditions around Shell Mound, Tenn., after occupation by Union troops; the occupation of Charleston, S.C., by African American troops; and a school for freedmen run by Union troops on Sullivan's Island. Writers of these letters are Julian F. DeWitt and other members of the DeWitt family, and James G. Foster.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Dewitt family Papers, 1863-1866, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Topics of these miscellaneous letters include the use of substitutes in the draft in New York; conditions around Shell Mound, Tenn., after occupation by Union troops; the occupation of Charleston, S.C., by African American troops; and a school for freedmen run by Union troops on Sullivan's Island. Writers of these letters are Julian F. DeWitt and other members of the DeWitt family, and James G. Foster.
